intro: Manihot surumuensis, commonly known as the Surumu wild manioc, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a starchy root system that is used by indigenous communities for food and traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its ecological and cultural significance, it is an important species in the study of plant biodiversity in the region.
